content: In the following questions, I will provide a target Python program code. The code is a program containing a loop, and the purpose of the code is indicated by its function name. Please provide a loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop to prove the partial correctness of the program. The loop invariant should be written in the form 'xxx_value = fun(arr[xxx]->arr[xxx])'. (Please note that your answer should only contain statements in the specified format without any additional text.)

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided program is:


```less
max_value_i = find_max(arr[i:i+1])
```
This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is correctly updated during each iteration of the loop. It proves the partial correctness of the program because it ensures that the maximum value found at each iteration is updated correctly based on the input array.

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop in the provided program is:


```less
max_value_i = find_max(arr[i:])
```
This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is correctly updated during each iteration of the loop. It proves the correctness of the loop logic within the given function definition `find_max`. The invariant states that by excluding the last element in each subarray `arr[i:]`, we are finding the maximum value among all subarrays starting from index `i`. This invariant is true at the start of each iteration because the initial maximum value is set to the last element of the array.
